provider_arguments.info:
api_key - (Optional) This is the API key. It must be provided, but
it can also be sourced from the FASTLY_API_KEY environment variable

arguments.info:
domain - (Required) A set of Domain names to serve as entry points for your
Service. Defined below.

subblock.info: The domain that this Service will respond to

arguments.info:
backend - (Optional) A set of Backends to service requests from your Domains.
Defined below. Backends must be defined in this argument, or defined in the
vcl argument below

subblock.info: An IPv4, hostname, or IPv6 address for the Backend
Should this Backend be load balanced
How long to wait between bytes in milliseconds
How long to wait for a timeout in milliseconds
Number of errors to allow before the Backend is marked as down
How long to wait for the first bytes in milliseconds
The healthcheck name that should be used for this Backend
Maximum number of connections for this Backend
A name for this Backend
The port number Backend responds on. Default 80
Name of a condition, which if met, will select this backend during a request.
The POP of the shield designated to reduce inbound load.
CA certificate attached to origin.
SSL certificate hostname for cert verification
Be strict on checking SSL certs
SSL certificate hostname
SSL certificate hostname for SNI verification
The portion of traffic to send to a specific origins. Each origin receives weight/total of the traffic.

arguments.info:
condition - (Optional) A set of conditions to add logic to any basic
configuration object in this service. Defined below.

subblock.info: A number used to determine the order in which multiple conditions execute. Lower numbers execute first
The statement used to determine if the condition is met
Type of the condition, either `REQUEST`, `RESPONSE`, or `CACHE`

arguments.info:
cache_setting - (Optional) A set of Cache Settings, allowing you to override
when an item is not to be cached based on an above condition. Defined below

subblock.info: Action to take
Name of a condition to check if this Cache Setting applies
A name to refer to this Cache Setting
Max 'Time To Live' for stale (unreachable) objects.
The 'Time To Live' for the object

arguments.info:
gzip - (Required) A set of gzip rules to control automatic gzipping of
content. Defined below.

subblock.info: Name of a condition controlling when this gzip configuration applies.
Content types to apply automatic gzip to
File extensions to apply automatic gzip to. Do not include '.'
A name to refer to this gzip condition

arguments.info:
header - (Optional) A set of Headers to manipulate for each request. Defined
below.

subblock.info: One of set, append, delete, regex, or regex_repeat
Optional name of a cache condition to apply.
Header this affects
Don't add the header if it is already. (Only applies to 'set' action.). Default `false`
A name to refer to this Header object
Lower priorities execute first. (Default: 100.)
Regular expression to use (Only applies to 'regex' and 'regex_repeat' actions.)
Optional name of a request condition to apply.
Optional name of a response condition to apply.
Variable to be used as a source for the header content (Does not apply to 'delete' action.)
Value to substitute in place of regular expression. (Only applies to 'regex' and 'regex_repeat'.)
Type to manipulate: request, fetch, cache, response

arguments.info: healthcheck - (Optional) Automated healthchecks on the cache that can change how fastly interacts with the cache based on its health.

subblock.info: How often to run the healthcheck in milliseconds
The status code expected from the host
Which host to check
Whether to use version 1.0 or 1.1 HTTP
When loading a config, the initial number of probes to be seen as OK
Which HTTP method to use
A name to refer to this healthcheck
The path to check
How many healthchecks must succeed to be considered healthy
Timeout in milliseconds
The number of most recent healthcheck queries to keep for this healthcheck

arguments.info: The default hostname for the version
The default Time-to-live (TTL) for the version

force_destroy - (Optional) Services that are active cannot be destroyed. In
order to destroy the Service, set force_destroy to true. Default false.
request_setting - (Optional) A set of Request modifiers. Defined below

subblock.info: Allows you to terminate request handling and immediately perform an action
Disable collapsed forwarding
the host header
Force a cache miss for the request
Forces the request use SSL
Inject Fastly-Geo-Country, Fastly-Geo-City, and Fastly-Geo-Region
Comma separated list of varnish request object fields that should be in the hash key
How old an object is allowed to be, in seconds. Default `60`
Unique name to refer to this Request Setting
Name of a request condition to apply. If there is no condition this setting will always be applied.
Injects the X-Timer info into the request
X-Forwarded-For options

arguments.info:
s3logging - (Optional) A set of S3 Buckets to send streaming logs too.
Defined below.

subblock.info: S3 Bucket name to store logs in
Bucket endpoint
Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting
The version of the custom logging format used for the configured endpoint. Can be either 1 or 2. (Default: 1)
Gzip Compression level
How the message should be formatted.
Unique name to refer to this logging setup
Path to store the files. Must end with a trailing slash
How frequently the logs should be transferred, in seconds (Default 3600)
Name of a condition to apply this logging.
AWS Access Key
AWS Secret Key
specified timestamp formatting (default `%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.000`)

arguments.info:
papertrail - (Optional) A Papertrail endpoint to send streaming logs too.
Defined below.

subblock.info: The address of the papertrail service
Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting
Unique name to refer to this logging setup
The port of the papertrail service
Name of a condition to apply this logging

arguments.info:
sumologic - (Optional) A Sumologic endpoint to send streaming logs too.
Defined below.

subblock.info: Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting
The version of the custom logging format used for the configured endpoint. Can be either 1 or 2. (Default: 1)
How the message should be formatted.
Unique name to refer to this logging setup
Name of a condition to apply this logging.
The URL to POST to.

arguments.info:
gcslogging - (Optional) A gcs endpoint to send streaming logs too.
Defined below.

subblock.info: The name of the bucket in which to store the logs.
The email address associated with the target GCS bucket on your account.
Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting
Gzip Compression level
Unique name to refer to this logging setup
Path to store the files. Must end with a trailing slash
How frequently the logs should be transferred, in seconds (Default 3600)
Name of a condition to apply this logging.
The secret key associated with the target gcs bucket on your account.
specified timestamp formatting (default `%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.000`)

arguments.info: response_object - (Optional) Allows you to create synthetic responses that exist entirely on the varnish machine. Useful for creating error or maintenance pages that exists outside the scope of your datacenter. Best when used with Condition objects.

subblock.info: Name of the condition checked after we have retrieved an object. If the condition passes then deliver this Request Object instead.
The content to deliver for the response object
The MIME type of the content
Unique name to refer to this request object
Name of the condition to be checked during the request phase to see if the object should be delivered
The HTTP Response of the object
The HTTP Status Code of the object
Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting
The version of the custom logging format used for the configured endpoint. Can be either 1 or 2. (Default: 1)
Unique name to refer to this logging setup
The port number configured in Logentries
Name of a condition to apply this logging.
Use token based authentication (https://logentries.com/doc/input-token/)
Whether to use TLS for secure logging
The address of the syslog service
Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting
The version of the custom logging format. Can be either 1 or 2. (Default: 1)
How the message should be formatted.
Unique name to refer to this logging setup
The port of the syslog service
Name of a condition to apply this logging.
The Hostname used to verify the server's certificate
Authentication token
Use TLS for secure logging
The contents of this VCL configuration
Should this VCL configuration be the main configuration
A name to refer to this VCL configuration

attributes.info: id - The ID of the Service.

active_version - The currently active version of your Fastly
Service.
